etymologies: mid 17th century: from modern Latin suicidium ‘act of suicide’, suicida ‘person who commits suicide’, from Latin sui ‘of oneself’ + caedere ‘kill’

definitions: the action of killing oneself intentionally

examples.text: he committed suicide at the age of forty
a stretch of the line popular with would-be suicides

definitions: a course of action that is disastrously damaging to oneself or one's own interests

examples.text: it would be political suicide to restrict criteria for unemployment benefits

shortDefinitions: course of action which is disastrously damaging to oneself

definitions: relating to or denoting a violent act or attack carried out by a person who does not expect to survive it

examples.text: a suicide blast caused more deaths

shortDefinitions: of military or terrorist operation carried out by people who do not expect to survive it

definitions: a running drill consisting of a sprint to a set point (especially a line on a basketball court) and back to the start, immediately followed by additional sprints of lengthening distances

examples.text: we shot free throws and if we missed we ran suicides

shortDefinitions: running drill consisting of sprint to set point and back to start

examples.text: he leaves the service and then suicides
